description: 1 photograph : albumen print on card mount ; sheet 14.6 x 11.3 cm, mount 17.6 x 14.3 cm. | Walt Whitman, three-quarter length portrait, seated, facing right with arms folded across chest, wearing hat, looking at Peter Doyle, who is seated next to Whitmam on his left, half-length portrait, facing left, wearing hat, looking at Walt Whitman.

medium: 1 photograph : albumen print on card mount ; sheet 14.6 x 11.3 cm, mount 17.6 x 14.3 cm.
mediums: 1 photograph : albumen print on card mount ; sheet 14.6 x 11.3 cm, mount 17.6 x 14.3 cm.
notes: Forms part of: Feinberg-Whitman Collection (Library of Congress).
Exhibited: "Revising Himself : Walt Whitman" at the Library of Congress, 2005.
Exhibited: Dear Friends: American photographs of men together, 1840-1918, International Center for Photography, New York.
Exhibited: "Distance Avails Not: Walt Whitman at 200", Literary and Historical Manuscripts, at The Morgan Library & Museum, 225 Madison Avenue, New York, NY, June 14, 2019 - September 15, 2019.

Copy negative LC-USZ62-77004 was labeled as showing a photo in the Manuscript Division. But the copy negative pre-dates the transfer of the Feinberg-Whitman photos to P&P, and the portrait seems to match, although it was made before conservation treatment of the original print.
Photograph by Moses P. Rice and Sons, Washington, D.C.
